columns.id: A unique identifier for each mountain entry in the database.
columns.name: The common name by which the mountain is known.
columns.Height: The elevation of the mountain above sea level, typically measured in meters.
columns.Prominence: The height of the mountain's summit relative to the lowest contour line surrounding the peak, indicating its independence from nearby mountains.
columns.Range: The name of the mountain range to which the mountain belongs.
columns.Country: The nation in which the mountain is located.

mountain.table_description: The mountain table provides a detailed record of mountains, including their unique identifiers, names, elevations, prominence, associated ranges, and geographical locations.

columns.id: A unique identifier for each camera lens entry in the table.
columns.brand: The manufacturer or brand name of the camera lens.
columns.name: The full name or model designation of the camera lens.
columns.focal_length_mm: The focal length of the lens measured in millimeters, which affects the lens's field of view.
columns.max_aperture: The largest aperture setting of the lens, expressed in f-stops, which influences the amount of light that can pass through the lens.

camera_lens.table_description: The camera_lens table stores detailed information about various camera lenses, including their unique identifiers, brands, names, focal lengths, and maximum aperture settings.

columns.id: A unique identifier for each photo entry.
columns.camera_lens_id: References the camera lens used to take the photo.
columns.mountain_id: References the mountain that the photo depicts.
columns.color: Describes the color scheme of the photo.
columns.name: The title or name given to the photo.

photos.table_description: The photos table holds information about photographs taken of various mountains, including details about the camera lens used, the represented mountain, the color scheme of the image, and a descriptive name for each photo.
